payload.name: statistical-frequentist
payload.core: Inference about populations from samples using estimators, confidence intervals, hypothesis tests, and error rates. Emphasizes long-run properties of procedures under repeated sampling.

out.d: range with coverage guarantee under repeated sampling
probability of data as extreme under null hypothesis
Type I and Type II error rate guarantees

proc: select test statistic and sampling distribution
compute point estimate and standard error
construct confidence interval at chosen level
compare to significance threshold, report decision
check: test appropriate for data type and design
p-value interpreted as procedure property not belief

diff.bayesian: long-run frequency vs degree of belief; no priors
diff.inductive: formal probabilistic framework vs informal generalization
diff.experimental-design: analyzes collected data vs plans collection

ex.sit: A/B test: new checkout flow vs control. n=1000 per group. Conversion: 12% vs 10%.
steps: H0: p_new = p_ctrl; H1: p_new > p_ctrl
ex.insight: 2pp lift plausible but underpowered to detect; need larger n or accept uncertainty
